message: Does anybody have a different view to this?

My read on this at DrupalCon was that somebody starting afresh here should be deploying HTML5 Tools module if your aim is a mobile friendly site, as the mobile devices inherently use webkit which is now HTML5 by default. For native apps the best guide seems to be to use Titanium to consume data from Feeds/Services.
oh also i missed your talk at DrupalCon, any chance getting the video up?
My take on native apps is it is better to write them natively.

Hey Kyle, I saw your talk at BADCamp, and was wondering how the development of the IOS app you were writing to go with DIOS is coming along. I'm just getting into IOS development so it would be really great to have a working example to pick apart.
I think going the mobile web way makes the most sense vs writing a native app. At least in most cases you can get away with a mobile web version.
Travisc, My talk wasnt accepted at Chicago however I still went, everything that I showed you about DIOS there, is up here, https://github.com/workhabitinc/drupal-ios-sdk.

Garthumphreys, while I agree with you in some cases, Native is far superior in terms of speed, and reliability on each platform. Ive walked down the HTML 5 road multiple times and everytime I do, its usually easier, quicker, and more efficient to go native.
